page.title: 15Farming
page.content:
An Interview with Mrs Rockliffe.
Mrs Rockliffe has lived in her present house in Camblesforth for 28 years. Before that she lived at Escrick. The only livestock she keeps are bullocks. She owns 135 acres of land. "The harvest season is the hardest work...The crops we grow are, sugar beet, Winter wheat, Winter barley and Spring barley." Mrs Rockliffe is also a Parish Councillor."The playing field and the village hall have provided facilities for entertainment throughout the village." She told us she thought the village needed more green areas and needed to be kept pretty. As a Parish Councillor she sorts out the problems of the village. She attends the monthly W.I. meetings and enjoys painting and emroidery.
